name: Golnaz Habibi
bio:
AirOU Director and Principal investigator, Assistant professor, School of Computer Science.
Affiliations: Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering, and Data Science and Analytics Institute.
Faculty Advisor of Sooner Competitve Robotics.
Google Scholar .

name: Vineel Palla
bio: Summer 2024. I am Vineel Palla, a Master's student in Computer Science at the University of Oklahoma. My work focuses on machine learning, deep learning, and data science, using technologies like TensorFlow and Python. Currently, I am working on a project involving multi-camera and RADAR 3D object detection and tracking for smart infrastructure at city intersections. This project aims to use multiple monocular cameras at intersection corners to track pedestrians and cars, addressing the challenge of fusing data from multiple cameras with RADAR for accurate tracking.

name: Daniel Vargas
bio: Joined AirOU Spring 2022. First-year Ph.D student in Control Systems. His dissertation focus is designing a 6-DoF robotic arm to assist in neurosurgical operations to increase precision, safety, and efficiency. He graduated with a B.S. in Mechanical Engineering with a minor in Electrical and Computer Engineering in 2024. He has led the design and building of the Minicity, ARC, ARCPro, LIONN, the micro-quadcopter, and SARRS. His research interests are Neurosurgical & Neurorehabilitation Robotics, Robotic Stereotactic Radiotherapy, and Autonomous Navigation for Search & Rescue. For any questions, please reach out at dvargas88@ou.edu.

name: Daniel Perez-Melo
bio: Joined AirOU in Spring 2024. PhD student in Data Science and Analytics. BSc in Mechanical Engineering, University of Oklahoma. Daniel is from Chile, he enjoys outdoor activities, playing the piano, and a good cup of coffee in his free time. His research interests include Machine Learning applications, CAD modeling, and Autonomous Driving. He is also a proud United World College Scholar.

name: Job Elliott
bio: Joined AirOU in Spring 2025. PhD student in Computer Science

name: Jessica Lumry
bio: Joined AirOU in Summer 2025. Graduate student doing a Master's in Computer Science.

name: Mathis Morales
bio:
Joined AirOU in Spring 2024. Graduate student doing a Master's in Electrical and Computer Engineering. He has a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering from the University Polytechnic School of Clermont-Ferrand (Polytech Clermont), France, with a dual degree in Artificial Perception and Robotics from the University School of Physics and Engineering (EUPI) of Clermont-Ferrand, France.

His research interests include Robotics, Neural Networks, and Computer Vision. His thesis focuses on a Camera-Radar Multi Object Tracking (MOT) pipeline robust to sensor failure, based on filtering methods.

name: Evan Mcculley
bio: Joined AirOU in Fall 2024. Graduate student doing a Master's in Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering,

name: Tyler Roman
bio:
Summer 2022- Spring 2024. Senior student in Computer Science student with a minor in Mathematics pursuing honors. Previously, he's worked in 3Sigma Lab at the University of Oklahoma, focusing on Computational Neuroscience. He is also the Leader of the Sooner Rover Autonomous Team, proud Henderson Scholar, and the cofounder of turnstyl.
His research interests lie in robotics and network communication

name: Phong Nguyen
bio: Joined AirOU in Summer 2023. Senior student in Aerospace Engineering. He led the design of the Mini-City Bridge and the traffic lights integration within the Mini-City. He's currently helping work on the SARRS project, building the ARCPRO, and most recently, designing a low-cost micro-quadcopter, as well as assisting the creating the control system for it. His research interests are in 3D CAD, drone development, and robotics.

name: Subhash Chandra
bio:
Summer 2024-Fall 2024. Subhash Chandra is currently a Master's student at the Department of Computer Science, University of Oklahoma. His research interests lie in the areas of Artificial Intelligence, Reifrocement Learning, Robotics, Robotics using AR/VR, Cryptograpy, Large Language Models (LLM), Natural Language Processing (NLP), and High-Performance Computing (HPC).

Previously, Subhash was a Research Assistant at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc.), Bangalore, where he engaged in various research projects related to cryptography, automation, NLP, and virtual reality. His work at IISc. involved leading innovative projects and contributing significantly to advancements in these fields.

For more information, visit his web page : Website

name: Ethan Haque
bio:
Joined AirOU in Spring 2023. Senior student in Computer Science on the Accelerated Masters track while minoring in Mathematics, Economics, and Psychology. He is a freelance designer, which includes but is not limited to photography, graphic design, illustration, mobile app development, and UI/UX Design.
His research interests include: Autonomous Vehicles, Medical Imaging Technology, Computer vision, and Artificial Intelligence. During his free time, he enjoys grabbing refreshers in cafes with people, birdwatching, playing the piano, and digital painting.

He is currently working on the The Social Behavior Classification in Animals project.

name: Nthati Lehloenya
bio: I am a junior in computer science, passionate about cybersecurity and AI. As a proud UWC scholar from the Kingdom of Lesotho, I’m committed to using technology for positive impact and serving my community. I manage operations at the OU Food Pantry, tutor math through the Transforming Tutoring Initiative, and provide prototyping and research development support using specialized workspaces in the Fabrication lab. As an associate in the Jerry Holmes Leadership Program, I focus on purposeful leadership, a skill I also apply as co-founder of the Gumboot Dance Club, where we celebrate South African heritage and honor the dance’s deep history of unity and resilience among Southern African miners during apartheid. Guided by my love for God, I aim to bring integrity and service to all my endeavors.

name: Aksel Can Sozudogru
bio:
Joined Summer 2024. Senior student in Computer Science. He is the founder of Rug Making Club as well as the CFO of the Sooner Racing Team which competes in Formula SAE, while also working as a Software Engineering Intern in the OU Information Technologies.

His research interests include Machine Learning, Computer Vision, and Network Communication.

name: Anany Pratap Gupta
bio: Summer 2024- Fall 2024. Senior at OU, passionate about AI and autonomous vehicle navigation development. Pursuing a bachelor's in computer science, I excel in web development, database management, and applying machine learning in astrophysics. I've worked on SLAM for autonomous systems and ROS migration projects., Currently, I'm involved in a smart city initiative, optimizing autonomous vehicle operations for safer urban mobility.

name: Keon Moradi
bio: Summer 2024-Fall 2024. Pursuing bachelor's degrees in Math and Computer Science. Involved with machine learning projects throughout undergraduate career, interested in graduate studies. Currently working in conjunction with Bentz lab (alongside Ethan Haque).

name: Matthew Carroll
bio:
Fall 2023- Spring 2024. Senior student in Computer Science, continuing into an accelerated Masters in Computer Science. He leads the campus Sailing Club as well as the environmental interest organization "Green Week", while also working as a Peer Tutor in the Gallogly College of Engineering Diversity and Inclusion program.
His research interests include machine learning and system development.

name: Mahmoud Sami
bio: Spring 2024. Postdoctoral research associate.

name: Manthan C. Chilweri
bio: Junior student in Mechanical Engineering

name: Parisa Masnadi Khiabani
bio:
Fall 2022. Ph.D. student in Data Science and Analytics at the University of Oklahoma. Parisa has a BS in electronics engineering from the Shariati Technical and Vocational College and an MS in mechatronics engineering from the K.N Toosi University in Tehran. Previously, she was a senior automotive embedded software developer at Capgemini Engineering and an active safety system engineer at Saipa Automotive Research and Innovation Center.
Her research interests are robotics, autonomous driving, multi-object tracking, autonomous control, and real-time embedded systems.

Google Scholar Page

name: Yuki Zheng
bio: Rising junior majoring in Computer Science and minoring in Math. Yuki is also a multimedia assistant career major completer, with three certifications in adobe premiere, photoshop, and multimedia. She is currently the Sooner Rover publicity coordinator and member of the autonomous sub-team, a Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers intern, the Society of Women Engineers publicity chair, a Diversity & Inclusion Scholar, and the co-founder and co-president of the first Girls Who Code college loop in the state. She is also a Halliburton Women's Welcome and ME^2 mentor.

name: Tate Smith
bio:
Tate is a master's student in Computer Science at the University of Oklahoma. He holds a BS in Computer Science with a minor in Economics, also from the University of Oklahoma. He currently works as a software developer for Paycom. He is also the cofounder of the OU C3 Cybersecurity Club. This semester he is working on developing an AI agent for the board game Risk.
His research interests include machine learning, genetic algorithms, and reinforcement learning.

name: Raj Saha
bio:
Raj Saha is a student at The University of Oklahoma pursuing an MS in Data Science & Analytics. He graduated from Bengal Institute of Technology, India in 2016 and started his professional journey in TCS, India as a data analyst for over five years. He is passionate and proficient at data mining, data analysis and visualization, big data processing, predictive model building, and strategic decision-making to achieve business objectives.

During his tenure through TCS, he developed AI Chatbot, Product Recommendation Engine, Automated Loan Approval system and Sales Forecasting model. His research areas include data science, machine learning, deep learning and artificial intelligence.

name: Avinash Reddy Nuthalapati
bio:
Msc student in Computer science. He has an BTech degree in computer science from MRCET, India.

His research interest includes Application development and Generative Adversarial Networks.

name: Maisha Maliha
bio:
Ph.D student in Computer Science. Master of Technology in Computer Science and Engineering, the Indian Institute of Technology Bombay, India (with full-funded fellowship- Indian Council for Cultural Relations Scholarship). Bachelor of Science in Information & Communications Engineering, East West University, Bangladesh. Priore Lecturer at a Polytechnic Institute, Department of Computer Science

Research interests: machine learning, artificial intelligence, IoT, natural language processing, computer vision and robotics. Hobbies: Maisha loves to see the sunset and enjoys traveling to new places.

Google Scholar Page

name: William Wilson
bio:
Msc student in computer science. He holds a Bsc in mechanical engineering and a minor in electrical engineering from the University of Oklahoma. He has developed software for the federal government and currently works as an embedded software engineer at the Advanced Radar Research Center (ARRC). He is currently engineering the next generation of radar systems.

His research interests include 3D visualization, image processing, sensor fusion, machine learning, and navigation. During his free time, he enjoys playing ultimate frisbee, chess, video games, working on his homelab, or rock climbing.

Website: mechaengineer.com

name: Aaron Hamil
bio: Junior student Computer Science. Joined Spring 2025.

name: Sasank Sribhashyam
bio: Masters student in Computer Science.

name: Christian Sink
bio: Joined Fall 2024. Undergraduate student in Aerospace and Mechanical Engineering
